Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of the most active compounds 3a, 3b, 6a, 6b, 8a and 9a was measured in vitro using twofold serial dilution technique
35 . The results of MIC were recorded in Table 1. It was noticed that compound 6a among other derivatives revealed excellent and the highest MIC value all over the tested strains. Moreover, the derivatives 3a and 6b were equipotent with the reference, amphotericin B against A. fumigates (MIC = 1.95 µg/mL) and exhibited two folds decrease in the potency than the standard, ciprofloxacin against S. pneumonia (MIC = 1.95 and 0.98 µg/mL, respectively). Additionally, 6b was equipotent in the antifungal activity with reference against A. fumigates. All the remaining derivatives illustrated from moderate-to-weak antimicrobial activity.
